میں اپنےداداکی ہبہ (تحفہ) کےبارےمیں ایک واضح فتویٰ یاوضاحت چاہتاہوں۔ میرےداداالحاج شیخ محمد کےچاربیٹےاوردوبیٹیاں ہیں،جن میں سے پہلے بیٹے کابچپن میں انتقال ہوگیا۔ میرے دادانے اپنے باقی تین بیٹوں اوردوبیٹیوں میں اپنی جائیداد تقسیم کی جب وہ زندہ اورصحتمند تھے۔ انہوں نےپہلی بیٹی کوایک پلاٹ اوردوسری بیٹی کودوسراپلاٹ دیا۔ دوسری بیٹی نے اپنے دادا سے ہبہ لےکرمکمل اختیار کے ساتھ وفات پائی۔ اب باقی تین بیٹوں میں سے ایک بیٹا،شیخ عبید کاانتقال ہوگیا ہے اوردوسرے دوبیٹے،شیخ عبدالرحمان اورشیخ سراج، زندہ ہیں۔ میرےدادانےتینوں بیٹوں کوبرابرجائیدادتقسیم کی۔ میرےوالدشیخ عبید کےانتقال 1996 میں، عمارت کی تعمیرمکمل ہوئی،جس میں دادا اوردادی کی موجودگی میں تمام بیٹوں کاسرمایہ شامل تھا۔ میرے والد کے انتقال کےبعد، میرے دادا 1998 میں وفات پاگئے، اوردادی 2012 میں انتقال کرگئیں۔ میرےدادااوردادی نےبھی اپنےپوتوں اورپوتیو,"<div class=""card-body ur"">

Ref. No. 3146/46-6047

الجواب

بسم اللہ الرحمن الرحیم:۔
پہلے چند اصولی باتیں سمجھ لیجئے تاکہ جواب سمجھنے میں آسانی ہو۔ 1۔ ہر شخص اپنی
زندگی میں اپنی جائداد کا مالک ہوتا ہے وہ اپنی مرضی سے جس کو کتنا چاہے دے
سکتاہے، یعنی ہبہ کرسکتاہے تاہم&nbsp
ہونے کے لئے شرط یہ ہے کہ اس کا اپنی زندگی میں ہی مالک بنادیاجائے، لہذا اگر کسی
نے زبانی ہبہ کیا لیکن رجسٹریشن وغیرہ کے ساتھ مالک نہیں بنایا تو وہ یہ وعدہ ہے،
ہبہ نہیں ہے اور اس زبانی ہبہ کا اس کے مرنے کے بعد کوئی اعتبار نہیں ہوگا اور کسی
کا دعوی مسموع نہیں ہوگا۔ 2۔ آدمی اپنی زندگی میں اپنی جائداد اپنے ورثہ میں تقسیم
کرسکتاہے اور ورثہ کو دینے میں بقدر ضرورت کمی بیشی بھی کرسکتاہے۔3۔ کسی مصلحت سے
رجسٹریشن کرادینا ملکیت کی دلیل نہیں ہے، لہذا جس کے نام پر کوئی پلاٹ رجسٹرد ہے
اگر دینے والے نے مالک بنایا ہے اور کہا ہے کہ یہ خالص تمہارا ہے &nbsp
column2: تو وہ موہوب لہ کا ہوگا۔&nbsp
column4: بیوی اور اولاد میں تقسیم ہوتی ہے، پوتے اور

column1: پوتیاں وغیرہ اس میں شامل نہیں ہوتی ہیں۔ 5۔ اگر مرحوم نے اپنی زندگی میں جائداد
تقسیم کی اور اس موقع پر پوتوں یا پوتیوں میں سے کسی کو کچھ دے کر مالک بنادیا تو
وہ خاص اسی &nbsp
column2: کا ہوگا، یعنی اگر دادا نے اپنی

column1: زندگی میں پوتوں کو کوئی پلاٹ وغیرہ ہبہ کیا تھا تو اس کے مرنے کے بعد بھی وہ
پوتوں کی ہی ہوگی۔ 6۔ باپ کی وراثت میں بیٹوں کے ساتھ بیٹیاں بھی حصہ دار ہیں،
لہذا اگر کسی کے بیٹوں نے اپنے باپ کی پراپرٹی آپس میں یعنی بھائیوں میں تقسیم کی

اور بہنوں کو حصہ نہیں دیا تو وہ شرعی تقسیم نہیں کہلائے گی۔

اب صورت مسئولہ میں اگر دادا شیخ محمد نے اپنی زندگی میں
اپنی جائداد اپنے تین بیٹوں اور دوبیٹیوں میں تقسیم کردیا اور ہر ایک کو مالک
بنادیا تو ہبہ تام ہوگیا اور ہر ایک اپنے حصہ کا جو اس کو دیاگیا مالک بن گیا۔ شیخ
عبید کو جو جائداد ملی وہ اس کا مالک ہوگیا اب اس حصہ پر شیخ محمد کا کوئی اختیار
باقی نہیں رہا۔ لہذا شیخ عبید کے مرنے کے بعد اس کے حصہ کی جائداد اس کی بیوی ،
بیٹے ، بیٹیوں اور والدین&nbsp
مطابق تقسیم ہوگی۔ اب اس جائداد کا اگر دادا دادی نے اپنی رضامندی سے صرف مرحوم کی
بیوی اور اس کےلڑکوں کو مالک&nbsp
غیرشرعی تقسیم ہوگی اور اب دوبارہ تقسیم کریں گے اور بیٹیوں کو بھی شامل کیاجائے
گا۔ ہاں اتنی بات ضرور ہے کہ ان کا جو حصہ شیخ عبید کی جائداد میں بنتاہے وہ شیخ
عبید کی بیوی اور بیٹوں میں بطور ہبہ تقسیم ہوگی اور اس میں شیخ عبید کی بیٹیاں
شامل نہیں ہوں گی ، لیکن اس کے علاوہ شیخ عبیدکی&nbsp
بقیہ جائداد میں بیٹوں کے ساتھ بیٹیاں بھی&nbsp
حصہ دار ہوں گی۔ &nbsp
ہوگا کہ کسی قریبی دارالقضا یا دارالافتا سے رجوع کرکے&nbsp
column3:
کو اچھی طرح سمجھ لیں ۔

معذور کی نماز جناب مفتى صاحب، مجھےپوچھنا يه هے كه ایک بیمار شخص، جس کے لیے زیادہ دیر تک کھڑا رہنا مشکل ہے اور کبھی کبھی تقریباً ناممکن ہو جاتا ہے، خاص طور پر فجر کی نماز میں جب لمبی قرات کے ساتھ نماز پڑھی جاتی ہے، تو وہ اگر پہلی رکعت میں بمشکل کھڑا ہو بھى جاۓ، لیکن دوسری رکعت میں کھڑا ہونا تقریباً ناممکن ہو جاتا ہےاور مجبور ہو کر بیٹھنا پڑھتا ہے۔ اگر وہ زبردستی کھڑا رہنے کی کوشش کرتا ہے تو اسے چکر آتے ہیں اور گرنے کی حالت پیدا ہو جاتی ہے، اور اس کے نتیجے میں وہ مزید بیمار ہو جاتا ہے۔ پھر دوسرے اوقات کی نمازیں بھی کھڑے ہو کر پڑھنا مشکل ہو جاتا ہے۔ البتہ، اگر چھوٹی چھوٹی سورتوں کے ساتھ نماز پڑھی جائے تو وہ آرام سے پوری نماز کھڑے ہو کر ادا کر سکتا ہے۔ ایسی صورت میں اس کو کیا کرنا چاهئے؟ کیا وہ جماعت میں شریک ہونے کا واجب ادا کرے اور بیٹھ کر نماز پڑھے، نہ کہ اکیلا چھوٹی چھوٹی سورتوں کے ساتھ کھ

Assalam o alaikum I work in a consulting firm that provides advisory services for mergers and acquisitions (M&amp
column2: A). My role involves using financial statements from target companies, which often include interest income and expenses. I do not directly calculate the interest figures, but I use the provided financial data to compute metrics like EBITDA and Net Earnings, which help clients decide whether to buy or sell a business. Is my involvement with these financial statements, which include interest-related data, permissible under Islamic Sharia law? Just to repeat I don’t enter or calculate interest it’s pre populated in our templates we just need to make sure each figure is aligned and output of our templates is correct.

The answer to your question is

as follows:

Your explanation effectively
captures the essence of consulting services. The primary goal of your firm is
to equip clients with the insights they need to better understand their

financial landscape and make informed investment decisions.

By evaluating financial
metrics like EBITDA, you can gauge a company's performance and its ability to
manage interest, taxes, and other financial responsibilities. Your role in
verifying the accuracy of the data provided is crucial, as it enables clients

to make decisions based on reliable information.

The importance of your
position cannot be overstated
column2: accurate information is the foundation upon

as per the ruling of Islamic Shariah.

Usury / Insurance
<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

My husband and I have been married for 4 years. Our nikkah took place in August 2020. In August 2021, we had a severe fight that escalated to physical violence. As a result, I left my husband's home. After that, he called, and we had a severe conflict during which my husband said,

Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

My husband and I have been married for 4 years. Our nikkah took place in August 2020. In August 2021, we had a severe fight that escalated to physical violence. As a result, I left my husband's home. After that, he called, and we had a severe conflict during which my husband said,
</button>
Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

column4: بیواؤں میں تملیک کے طور پر تقسیم کرے تو اس کی

column1: گنجائش ہے۔ اس سلسلہ میں لوگوں میں بیداری لائی جائے کہ سیاسی جماعت کے عام چندہ
میں زکوۃ کی رقم نہ دیں، ورنہ&nbsp
ادانہیں ہوگی۔&nbsp
""أما تفسيرها فهي تمليك
المال من فقير مسلم غير هاشمي، ولا مولاه بشرط قطع المنفعة عن المملك من كل وجه
لله&nbsp
الزکاۃ،ألباب الأول،ط:دار الفكر،بيروت)
""وَ لَايَجُوزُ أَنْ يَبْنِيَ بِالزَّكَاةِ الْمَسْجِدَ، وَكَذَا الْقَنَاطِرُ
وَالسِّقَايَاتُ، وَإِصْلَاحُ الطَّرَقَاتِ، وَكَرْيُ الْأَنْهَارِ وَالْحَجُّ
وَالْجِهَادُ وَكُلُّ مَا لَا تَمْلِيكَ فِيهِ، وَلَا يَجُوزُ أَنْ يُكَفَّنَ
بِهَا مَيِّتٌ، وَلَا يُقْضَى بِهَا دَيْنُ الْمَيِّتِ كَذَا فِي التَّبْيِينِ،
وَلَا يُشْتَرَى بِهَا عَبْدٌ يُعْتَقُ، وَلَا يَدْفَعُ إلَى أَصْلِهِ، وَإِنْ
عَلَا، وَفَرْعِهِ، وَإِنْ سَفَلَ كَذَا فِي الْكَافِي."" (الھندیۃ، كتاب الزكوة، الْبَابُ السَّابِعُ فِي
الْمَصَارِفِ، ١ / ١٨٨، ط: ظار الفكر)
""وَ لَا يَخْرُجُ عَنْ
الْعُهْدَةِ بِالْعَزْلِ بَلْ بِالْأَدَاءِ لِلْفُقَرَاءِ."" (شامي، كتاب الزكوة، ٢ / ٢٧٠، ط: دار الفكر)
""وَ يُشْتَرَطُ أَنْ
يَكُونَ الصَّرْفُ (تَمْلِيكًا) لَا إبَاحَةً كَمَا مَرَّ."" (شامي، كتاب الزكوة، باب مصرف الزكوة و العشر، ٢ / ٣٤٤، ط: دار الفكر)

column2: بشرط صحت سوال صورت مسئولہ میں دوسرا مسلمان

column1: مرتد نہیں ہوا، اس کے کہنے کا مطلب یہ ہے کہ تم جو زبردستی زبان سے کہلوانا چاہتے
ہو حالانکہ زبانی کلمہ پڑھنا ضروری نہیں اور جو پہلے سے مسلمان ہو اس کے لئے زبان
سے سب کے سامنے کلمہ پڑھنا&nbsp
کہنے والے کا یہ مقصد ہرگز نہیں تھا کہ میں مسلمان ہی نہیں ہوں۔سیاق و سباق سے
گرچہ ایمان سے خارج نہیں ہوا تاہم شوہر پر لازم ہے کہ وہ توبہ واستغفار کرے اور
آئندہ کے لیے ایسے الفاظ کہنے سے سخت اجتناب کرے۔
رجل
ضرب امرأته فقالت المرأة: لست بمسلم، فقال الرجل: هب أني لست بمسلم، قال الشيخ
الإمام أبو بكر محمد بن الفضل رحمه الله تعالى: لا يصير كافرا بذلك، فقد حكي عن
بعض أصحابنا أن رجلا لو قيل له :ألست بمسلم؟ فقال: لا ،لايكون ذلك كفرا ؛لأن قول
الناس: لیس بمسلم معناہ: أن أفعالہ لیست من أفعال المسلمین. وقال الشیخ الامام الزاهد
رحمه الله تعالی: اذا لم یکن ذلك کفرا عند بعض الناس فقوله: هب أني لست بمسلم أبعد
من ذلك. (الفتاوی الخانیة: (کتاب السیر،
باب ما یکون کفرا من المسلم وما لا یکون، 425/3، ط: دار الفکر)

column1: مسجد کی اصل وضع اور امت کے متوارث عمل کے خلاف ہے، نیز نچلی منزل کا خالی رہنا

پہلے چند اصولی باتیں سمجھ لیجئے تاکہ جواب سمجھنے میں آسانی ہو۔ 1۔ ہر شخص اپنی
زندگی میں اپنی جائداد کا مالک ہوتا ہے وہ اپنی مرضی سے جس کو کتنا چاہے دے
سکتاہے، یعنی ہبہ کرسکتاہے تاہم&nbsp
ہونے کے لئے شرط یہ ہے کہ اس کا اپنی زندگی میں ہی مالک بنادیاجائے، لہذا اگر کسی
نے زبانی ہبہ کیا لیکن رجسٹریشن وغیرہ کے ساتھ مالک نہیں بنایا تو وہ یہ وعدہ ہے،
ہبہ نہیں ہے اور اس زبانی ہبہ کا اس کے مرنے کے بعد کوئی اعتبار نہیں ہوگا اور کسی
کا دعوی مسموع نہیں ہوگا۔ 2۔ آدمی اپنی زندگی میں اپنی جائداد اپنے ورثہ میں تقسیم
کرسکتاہے اور ورثہ کو دینے میں بقدر ضرورت کمی بیشی بھی کرسکتاہے۔3۔ کسی مصلحت سے
رجسٹریشن کرادینا ملکیت کی دلیل نہیں ہے، لہذا جس کے نام پر کوئی پلاٹ رجسٹرد ہے
اگر دینے والے نے مالک بنایا ہے اور کہا ہے کہ یہ خالص تمہارا ہے &nbsp
column2: تو وہ موہوب لہ کا ہوگا۔&nbsp
column4: بیوی اور اولاد میں تقسیم ہوتی ہے، پوتے اور

column1: پوتیاں وغیرہ اس میں شامل نہیں ہوتی ہیں۔ 5۔ اگر مرحوم نے اپنی زندگی میں جائداد
تقسیم کی اور اس موقع پر پوتوں یا پوتیوں میں سے کسی کو کچھ دے کر مالک بنادیا تو
وہ خاص اسی &nbsp
column2: کا ہوگا، یعنی اگر دادا نے اپنی

column1: زندگی میں پوتوں کو کوئی پلاٹ وغیرہ ہبہ کیا تھا تو اس کے مرنے کے بعد بھی وہ
پوتوں کی ہی ہوگی۔ 6۔ باپ کی وراثت میں بیٹوں کے ساتھ بیٹیاں بھی حصہ دار ہیں،
لہذا اگر کسی کے بیٹوں نے اپنے باپ کی پراپرٹی آپس میں یعنی بھائیوں میں تقسیم کی

اور بہنوں کو حصہ نہیں دیا تو وہ شرعی تقسیم نہیں کہلائے گی۔

اب صورت مسئولہ میں اگر دادا شیخ محمد نے اپنی زندگی میں
اپنی جائداد اپنے تین بیٹوں اور دوبیٹیوں میں تقسیم کردیا اور ہر ایک کو مالک
بنادیا تو ہبہ تام ہوگیا اور ہر ایک اپنے حصہ کا جو اس کو دیاگیا مالک بن گیا۔ شیخ
عبید کو جو جائداد ملی وہ اس کا مالک ہوگیا اب اس حصہ پر شیخ محمد کا کوئی اختیار
باقی نہیں رہا۔ لہذا شیخ عبید کے مرنے کے بعد اس کے حصہ کی جائداد اس کی بیوی ،
بیٹے ، بیٹیوں اور والدین&nbsp
مطابق تقسیم ہوگی۔ اب اس جائداد کا اگر دادا دادی نے اپنی رضامندی سے صرف مرحوم کی
بیوی اور اس کےلڑکوں کو مالک&nbsp
غیرشرعی تقسیم ہوگی اور اب دوبارہ تقسیم کریں گے اور بیٹیوں کو بھی شامل کیاجائے
گا۔ ہاں اتنی بات ضرور ہے کہ ان کا جو حصہ شیخ عبید کی جائداد میں بنتاہے وہ شیخ
عبید کی بیوی اور بیٹوں میں بطور ہبہ تقسیم ہوگی اور اس میں شیخ عبید کی بیٹیاں
شامل نہیں ہوں گی ، لیکن اس کے علاوہ شیخ عبیدکی&nbsp
بقیہ جائداد میں بیٹوں کے ساتھ بیٹیاں بھی&nbsp
حصہ دار ہوں گی۔ &nbsp
ہوگا کہ کسی قریبی دارالقضا یا دارالافتا سے رجوع کرکے&nbsp

<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

My husband and I have been married for 4 years. Our nikkah took place in August 2020. In August 2021, we had a severe fight that escalated to physical violence. As a result, I left my husband's home. After that, he called, and we had a severe conflict during which my husband said,
</button>
Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

Usury / Insurance
<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

Usury / Insurance
<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

The

Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

Buying medical health insurance policy specially in india ,is it halal or haraam according to quraan. And what another option is there if medical insurance is not permissible. I wanna clear this most confusing yet trending topic/question. Kindly guide me in the light of Quran . And please clarify If someone have medical emergency with no money what we have to do ......?how to pay hospital bills and medical expenses?? Jazakallah khair,"<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best

Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

My husband and I have been married for 4 years. Our nikkah took place in August 2020. In August 2021, we had a severe fight that escalated to physical violence. As a result, I left my husband's home. After that, he called, and we had a severe conflict during which my husband said,

Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Buying medical health insurance policy specially in india ,is it halal or haraam according to quraan.
And what another option is there if medical insurance is not permissible.
I wanna clear this most confusing yet trending topic/question.
Kindly guide me in the light of Quran .

If someone have medical emergency with no money what we have to do ......?how to pay hospital bills and medical expenses??

Usury / Insurance
<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

بنادیا تو ہبہ تام ہوگیا اور ہر ایک اپنے حصہ کا جو اس کو دیاگیا مالک بن گیا۔ شیخ
عبید کو جو جائداد ملی وہ اس کا مالک ہوگیا اب اس حصہ پر شیخ محمد کا کوئی اختیار
باقی نہیں رہا۔ لہذا شیخ عبید کے مرنے کے بعد اس کے حصہ کی جائداد اس کی بیوی ،
بیٹے ، بیٹیوں اور والدین&nbsp
مطابق تقسیم ہوگی۔ اب اس جائداد کا اگر دادا دادی نے اپنی رضامندی سے صرف مرحوم کی
بیوی اور اس کےلڑکوں کو مالک&nbsp
غیرشرعی تقسیم ہوگی اور اب دوبارہ تقسیم کریں گے اور بیٹیوں کو بھی شامل کیاجائے
گا۔ ہاں اتنی بات ضرور ہے کہ ان کا جو حصہ شیخ عبید کی جائداد میں بنتاہے وہ شیخ
عبید کی بیوی اور بیٹوں میں بطور ہبہ تقسیم ہوگی اور اس میں شیخ عبید کی بیٹیاں
شامل نہیں ہوں گی ، لیکن اس کے علاوہ شیخ عبیدکی&nbsp
بقیہ جائداد میں بیٹوں کے ساتھ بیٹیاں بھی&nbsp
حصہ دار ہوں گی۔ &nbsp
ہوگا کہ کسی قریبی دارالقضا یا دارالافتا سے رجوع کرکے&nbsp

<div id=""collapse12709"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12709"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">

Ref. No. 3153/46-6030

In the name of Allah the most

Gracious the most Merciful

The answer to your question

is as follows:

The prohibition of gambling
and interest (usury) is clearly established in the Quran and Hadith, and all the
dealings based on gambling and interest are haram and unlawful. Medical health
insurance often contains elements of gambling or interest, which is why it is
generally considered impermissible under Sharia. If a medical issue arises
within a specified period, the insured receives money with interest
conversely, if no disease develops, the deposited amount is not refunded, thus

it also falls under the definition of gambling.

However, if a company deems
health insurance compulsory, employees may only utilize medical benefits to the
extent of the amount collected through the insurance. Getting more than this amount
would not be permissible. In cases of financial hardship or lack of resources

for treatment, there is some allowance based on necessity.

This raises the question of
what Muslims should do in such situations. The answer is that the community
organizations should establish a structured plan for medical assistance and raise
a fund to support vulnerable Muslims facing serious health issues. In India,
for example, numerous schools, spiritual centers, and charitable organizations
operate on public donations, contributing significantly to community welfare. A
similar fund can be raised specifically for medical assistance to benefit the

poor.

Additionally, the aid of the
government should be sought. For programs or medical cards through which the
government allocates funds for treatment, it is advisable to consult with

experts to get maximum benefit.

And Allah knows best
Darul Uloom Waqf Deoband

My husband and I have been married for 4 years. Our nikkah took place in August 2020. In August 2021, we had a severe fight that escalated to physical violence. As a result, I left my husband's home. After that, he called, and we had a severe conflict during which my husband said,
</button>
Divorce &
<div id=""collapse12695"" class=""collapse"" aria-labelledby=""heading12695"" data-parent=""#accordionExample"">
<div class=""card-body en"">
In
the name of Allah the most Gracious the most Merciful
The
answer to your question is as follows:
Islam, Nikah (marriage) is considered a sacred bond, and Islam emphasizes its
stability by encouraging mutual love, affection, and fulfillment of each
other's rights. However, if for some reasons, there is discord between the
husband and wife, the elders of both families should first attempt to
reconcile, as divorce is regarded as a disliked act in Islam, and its
unnecessary use is not appropriate.
If
there is no way for reconciliation and there is a fear of discord and conflict,
then Islam permits separating with one explicit divorce (Talaq). After one
divorce, if they wish to reunite, they can do so during the Iddah (waiting
period) through reconciliation or after the Iddah by remarrying.
Issuing
three divorces at once is considered a sin in Islamic law and is also a
punishable offense under the country's legal system.)
In
our common usage, the word ""Azad"" (free) is clearly used to mean
divorce. Therefore, even without the intention, one revocable divorce
(Talaq-e-Raj'i) has taken place. The husband then gave a second divorce and
reconciled, and later gave a third conditional divorce which was fulfilled. As
a result, all three irrevocable divorces (Talaq-e-Mughallazah) have occurred,
making it forbidden and sinful for both of you to continue living together, and
the Nikah (marriage) is also prohibited.
Now,
the woman is all the way free, and after completing her Iddah (waiting period),

she may marry another man if she wishes to do so.

And Allah knows best

Darul Ifta

""وَ لَايَجُوزُ أَنْ يَبْنِيَ بِالزَّكَاةِ الْمَسْجِدَ، وَكَذَا الْقَنَاطِرُ
وَالسِّقَايَاتُ، وَإِصْلَاحُ الطَّرَقَاتِ، وَكَرْيُ الْأَنْهَارِ وَالْحَجُّ
وَالْجِهَادُ وَكُلُّ مَا لَا تَمْلِيكَ فِيهِ، وَلَا يَجُوزُ أَنْ يُكَفَّنَ
بِهَا مَيِّتٌ، وَلَا يُقْضَى بِهَا دَيْنُ الْمَيِّتِ كَذَا فِي التَّبْيِينِ،
وَلَا يُشْتَرَى بِهَا عَبْدٌ يُعْتَقُ، وَلَا يَدْفَعُ إلَى أَصْلِهِ، وَإِنْ
عَلَا، وَفَرْعِهِ، وَإِنْ سَفَلَ كَذَا فِي الْكَافِي."" (الھندیۃ، كتاب الزكوة، الْبَابُ السَّابِعُ فِي
الْمَصَارِفِ، ١ / ١٨٨، ط: ظار الفكر)
""وَ لَا يَخْرُجُ عَنْ
الْعُهْدَةِ بِالْعَزْلِ بَلْ بِالْأَدَاءِ لِلْفُقَرَاءِ."" (شامي، كتاب الزكوة، ٢ / ٢٧٠، ط: دار الفكر)
""وَ يُشْتَرَطُ أَنْ
يَكُونَ الصَّرْفُ (تَمْلِيكًا) لَا إبَاحَةً كَمَا مَرَّ."" (شامي، كتاب الزكوة، باب مصرف الزكوة و العشر، ٢ / ٣٤٤، ط: دار الفكر)
واللہ اعلم بالصواب

الجواب
بسم اللہ الرحمن الرحیم:۔
column2: بشرط صحت سوال صورت مسئولہ میں دوسرا مسلمان

column1: مرتد نہیں ہوا، اس کے کہنے کا مطلب یہ ہے کہ تم جو زبردستی زبان سے کہلوانا چاہتے
ہو حالانکہ زبانی کلمہ پڑھنا ضروری نہیں اور جو پہلے سے مسلمان ہو اس کے لئے زبان
سے سب کے سامنے کلمہ پڑھنا&nbsp
کہنے والے کا یہ مقصد ہرگز نہیں تھا کہ میں مسلمان ہی نہیں ہوں۔سیاق و سباق سے
گرچہ ایمان سے خارج نہیں ہوا تاہم شوہر پر لازم ہے کہ وہ توبہ واستغفار کرے اور
آئندہ کے لیے ایسے الفاظ کہنے سے سخت اجتناب کرے۔
رجل
ضرب امرأته فقالت المرأة: لست بمسلم، فقال الرجل: هب أني لست بمسلم، قال الشيخ
الإمام أبو بكر محمد بن الفضل رحمه الله تعالى: لا يصير كافرا بذلك، فقد حكي عن
بعض أصحابنا أن رجلا لو قيل له :ألست بمسلم؟ فقال: لا ،لايكون ذلك كفرا ؛لأن قول
الناس: لیس بمسلم معناہ: أن أفعالہ لیست من أفعال المسلمین. وقال الشیخ الامام الزاهد
رحمه الله تعالی: اذا لم یکن ذلك کفرا عند بعض الناس فقوله: هب أني لست بمسلم أبعد
من ذلك. (الفتاوی الخانیة: (کتاب السیر،
باب ما یکون کفرا من المسلم وما لا یکون، 425/3، ط: دار الفکر)
واللہ اعلم بالصواب
